full_text: Erste CI Biz i Te IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2021/KER/297 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE V.G.ARUN TUESDAY, THE O5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2021 / 15TH POUSHA, 1942 Cri .MC.No.5213 OF 2020 (B) AGAINST THE JUDGMENT IN SC 948/2019 OF ADDITIONAL DISTRICT COURT & SESSIONS COURT - III, MANJERI CRIME NO.178/2016 OF Vengara Police Station , Malappuram PETITIONERS : 1 MANTKATHODI SHIBILI AGED 28 YEARS S/O. ABDUL KAREEM, MANIKATHOIDI HOUSE, KANNADIPADI P.O. MALAPPURAM DISTRICT 676 304. 2 MUHAMMED YASIN, AGED 30 YEARS S/O. USSAIN, KOTTEKKATTU HOUSE, KANNADIPADI P.O. MALAPPURAM DISTRICT 676 304. BY ADV. SHRI.JINU JOSEPH RESPONDENTS: 1 ABDUL LATHEEF AGED 51 YEARS S/O. ALAVI, PANAKKAL HOUSE, KANNATTIPADI P.O. MALAPPURAM DISTRICT 676 304. 2 STATE OF KERALA, REPRESEND BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM 682 031. R1 BY ADV. P.K.MOHAMED JAMEEL SR.PP.C.S.HRITHWIK;PP T.R.RENJITH THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05.01.2021, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Bena Crmc 5213/2020 2 2021/KER/297 V.G.ARUN, J. -CGrLM.C.NO.5213 of 2020. Dated this the 5* day of January, 2021 ORDER Petitioners are the accused in Crime No.178 of 2016 registered at the Vengara Police Station for the offence punishable under Sections 341, 323, 326 r/w 34 of IPC, now pending as S.C.No.948 of 2019 on the files of Additional District and Sessions Court-III, Manjeri. The de facto complainant at whose instance the crime was registered is the 1* respondent. Annexure A2 affidavit has been filed by the 1* respondent, stating that the dispute has been settled and that he has no subsisting grievance against the petitioners. 2. Heard the learned Public Prosecutor also, who, on instructions, submits that the petitioners have no criminal antecedents. 3. Having considered the gravity of the offences alleged, nature of the injury caused and having perused the affidavit filed by the 1* respondent, the contents of which are submitted to be true and voluntary, I am satisfied that the dispute is settled and that no public interest is involved in this matter. Moreover, in view of the settlement, possibility of the criminal proceedings PSE Crmc 5213/2020 3 2021U/KER(297 ending in conviction is remote. As such, continuance of the proceedings will amount to an abuse of process of court and hence, in view of the legal position set out by the Honourable Supreme Court in Madan Mohan Abbot v. State of Punjab [(2008) 4 SCC 582] and Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and another [(2012) 10 SCC 303], there is no impediment in granting the relief sought. 4. In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The proceedings in S.C.No.948 of 2019 on the files of Additional District and Sessions Court-III, Manjeri is quashed. Sd/- V.G.ARUN JUDGE 1gk rs as pated | CoE: 4 Te Crmc 5213/2020 4 2021/KER/297 APPENDIX OF Cr1.MC 5213/2020 PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED COPY OF FINAL REPROT IN CRIME NO. 178/2016 OF VENGARA POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A2 ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT OF 1ST RESPONDENT.
